message: I wouldn't, honestly
I <3 The National, and their latest, High Violet, is excellent
Yep, The National are awesome... they were so good at the Fox last  year.
you know, I've got that, too
I was there!
agreed, excellent show
I liked the Arcade Fire's "The Suburbs" though I'm not sure I'd put it up there with their previous two albums.
but I've yet to queue it up ;-)
good album, but not their best
Man... I really don't listen to new music haha.  I don't know any of these bands
I favorite if I appreciate/agree with the comment
it's basically nine songs of his more calming/soothing tunes, which i always thought was him at his best
and I love the background trumpet that peppers the songs
I'm loving the Tron soundtrack
Yeah, i've heard good things about that, and the soundtrack Trent Reznor did for "The Social Network"
I've been listening to Kanye's album for a month or so now
The fact that Kanye is popular makes me feel like I'm getting trolled by the whole world lol
anyone heard anything that grabbed their attention? I can't really think of anything off-hand.
oof, good question
I've been really into this band Dungen lately.  Guess that's the first band that comes to mind for me when I think about new music to recommend.
I've picked up "The Social Network" ost but have yet to play it
and haven't listened to it
I'm with you there, @kevinflo, which is why I picked up his latest
I figured I'd listen to it a couple of times and see if it caught me
I think I just don't get him or something
Convore seems to really love Kanye though
I just recently purchased Slowwave (Drag Lake Sin) and really enjoy it
totally laid back and relaxing
really? I loved the Suburbs... but it took a while for me to get into it
*also* haven't listened to it (geez, I think I have a problem)
I've been kind of into Ra Ra Riot lately
I think I've only played it twice
oooh, Ra Ra Riot's good
Arcade Fire tends to go that route
Kids these days!
@leah: i just might
now i'm thinking about how favoriting should work
man, this takes me back to six apart and our interminable debates about favoriting vs. bookmarking vs. liking vs. god knows what
hey, hey, hey, pull this over to feedback/favoriting-star ;-)
hmm... maybe I need to listen to it a couple more times
Yeah, I think it's an album that I need to listen to in its entirety more
listened to them today, actually
also @djchall, feel free to invite more people to join
i mean, that's what i call it.... using it to indicate agreement is interesting
no worries
it's purposefully ambiguous
the new iron and wine is quite good, although not as consistent of an effort as spepherd's dog
i've not listened to iron and wine on their own--i love the ep they did with Calexico
who needs a girlfriend when i have that? right? right?
I also just picked up British Sea Power's Valhalla Dancehall
It's truly an old-fashioned "album" not just a collection of tracks to feed into iTunes shuffle or "genius"
which I love
btw - I tend to "star" when I agree with something
off-topic is fine
yeah, and it always seems to be partially married to the female vocals as well.
i need to get that British Sea Power album... I'm seeing them at the Independent sometime soon
I actually don't shuffle that often
aaaaand once again i've gone off-topic
also, in the code it's just called "star"
haven't even finished it
(I think I really do have a problem...)
the new destroy gives me great gladness
..destroyer*
that sort of strikes the middle era of his stuff. if you liked the full instrumentation of it, check out the shepherd's dog->woman king->kiss each other clean
if it was mostly the songwriting vocals, throw creek drank the cradle and sea & the rhythm in there as well
thanks for the rec, @jacob, just purchased Kaputt
i've gone to bed with it every night since it's come out
which i'm a sucker for anyhow
now all i need is a new neko case and jens lekman this year and all my favorites would have released something new in the last 18 months
yeah, this is totally laid back
i have a "love, neko" signed poster of her on top of the mercury cougar in my room
am i going to go home and put it on the record player? yes i am
heh, ditto
erm, joanna may have been a little bit more than that. oh well.
everything other than bfl and virginian are 8.5 are better albums though
aaaaand now I've purchased Blacklisted and Fox Confessor
neko case is awesome
I've only got one Neko album, Middle Cyclone
"Fox Confessor Brings the Flood" is my favorite
blacklisted > middle cyclone > tigers have spoken > fox confessor > blood furnance lullaby > the virginian
and those are pretty great too
her voice could melt the pole caps
deep red bells is pretty much the greatest thing ever
"Machines" is an awesome song
There's a local band in Minneapolis who I've caught 3 times and had my mind blown each time http://www.myspace.com/hawksoxen
think mars volta + king crimson + a little... jazzyness
whoops
@kevinflo you might like http://www.tigerasylum.com/Artists/SHREDfest.html
Heavier on the jazziness and noise, lighter on the mars volta
@kevinflo Hawks & Oxen is pretty sweet!
@tilgovi Cool, I'll check them out
Also, H & O is like 10X better live.  They're making a new album right now too and the songs sound awesome.
hall and oates?!?!
/headbang

@tilgovi noted
It's no In Ghost Colours, but it's ok.  I'm hoping it grows on me, but even after 10 or so listens I still find myself playing IGC when I'm in the Cut Copy mood instead of Zonoscope.
@jacob (y) or (n)?
My album of 2010: Holy Fuck - Latin.
@ekpyrotic I didn't know they had an album in 2010, yay! I'll get it. I saw them back in '06 w/ Wolf Parade and they were awesome.
just the best electronic music in the world: http://www.binaerpilot.no/
@EisFrei That's a really bold claim. One that I shall investigate immediately.
Ok. I disagree.
But it's pretty good.
The James Blake EP is incredible... Other than that, Jamie xx's Gil Scott Heron rework "We're New Here", it's brilliant

I'll tip PJ Harvey - Let England Shake as a Mercury Prize contender, along with best album of 2011 so far. Some overwhelming reviews on Metacritic: http://www.metacritic.com/music/let-england-shake/critic-reviews
@lachenmayer We're New Here is definitely in my 2010 top ten albums. My fav. tracks are Me and the Devil, I'm New Here, On Coming From a Broken Home, and Your Soul And Mine.
@tilgovi binärpilot has a wide variety of styles. a few songs of note i really fell in love with: iritis, geeks, cornered promo, smile, dance, otosclerosis

If you are into the folky, bluegrass side of the things the Civil Wars is a great band that has had a lot of well deserved buzz lately. Their single "Barton Hallow" kills! http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JrOUwbsy12E
correction: "Barton Hollow"

Also, have really been digging a band out of Long Beach called The Romany Rye. They have a really good daytrotter performance here: http://www.daytrotter.com/dt/the-romany-rye-concert/20031096-3738244.html
